{{Infobox scientist | name = Ronald Coifman | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = 1941 | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Israel]]
[[United States]] | fields = [[Mathematics]] | workplaces = [[Yale University]] | alma_mater = [[University of Geneva]] | doctoral_advisor = [[Jovan Karamata]] | doctoral_students = [[Sijue Wu]] | known_for = | awards = [[National Medal of Science]] (1999) }} '''Ronald Raphael Coifman''' is the Phillips [[Professor]] of [[Mathematics]] at [[Yale University]]. Coifman earned a doctorate from the [[University of Geneva]] in 1965, supervised by [[Jovan Karamata]].{{MathGenealogy |id=5851}} Coifman is a member of the [[American Academy of Arts and Sciences]], the [[Connecticut Academy of Science and Engineering]], and the [[United States National Academy of Sciences|National Academy of Sciences]]. He is a recipient of the 1996 [[DARPA]] Sustained Excellence Award, the 1996 Connecticut Science Medal, the 1999 Pioneer Award of the International Society for Industrial and Applied Science, and the 1999 [[National Medal of Science]].[http://www.cs.yale.edu/people/coifman.html Ronald Coifman -- Faculty Computer Science, Yale][http://www.nsf.gov/od/nms/recip_details.cfm?recip_id=86 National Science Foundation - The President's National Medal of Science] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{Winners of the National Medal of Science|math-stat-comp}} {{Persondata | NAME = Coifman, Ronald | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Israeli mathematician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1941 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Coifman, Ronald}} [[Category:Members of the United States National Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American Jews]] [[Category:20th-century American mathematicians]] [[Category:21st-century American mathematicians]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Israeli mathematicians]] [[Category:Yale University faculty]] [[Category:National Medal of Science laureates]] [[Category:1941 births]] {{Israel-scientist-stub}}
